solution_line_template: First find the total time Carly practices the butterfly stroke in a week: {butterfly_hours_per_day} hours/day * {butterfly_days_per_week} days/week = <<{butterfly_hours_per_day}*{butterfly_days_per_week}={butterfly_weekly}>>{butterfly_weekly} hours/week

Then find the total time Carly practices the backstroke stroke in a week: {backstroke_hours_per_day} hours/day * {backstroke_days_per_week} days/week = <<{backstroke_hours_per_day}*{backstroke_days_per_week}={backstroke_weekly}>>{backstroke_weekly} hours/week

Then add those two amounts of time to find her total practice time each week: {butterfly_weekly} hours/week + {backstroke_weekly} hours/week = <<{butterfly_weekly}+{backstroke_weekly}={total_weekly}>>{total_weekly} hours/week

Then multiply her weekly practice time by the number of weeks in a month to find her monthly practice time: {total_weekly} hours/week * {weeks_per_month} weeks/month = <<{total_weekly}*{weeks_per_month}={total_monthly}>>{total_monthly} hours/month
